text: The 2003 FIFA Women's World Cup was the fourth FIFA Women's World Cup. It took place in the United States. The winners were Germany. == Group stage == === Group A === Team 3 3 0 0 11 1 +10 9 3 2 0 1 5 3 +2 6 North Korea 3 1 0 2 3 4 −1 3 Nigeria 3 0 0 3 0 11 −11 0 === Group B === Team Brazil 3 2 1 0 8 2 +6 7 3 2 0 1 10 5 +5 6 France 3 1 1 1 2 3 −1 4 South Korea 3 0 0 3 1 11 −10 0 === Group C === Team 3 3 0 0 13 2 +11 9 3 2 0 1 7 5 +2 6 3 1 0 2 7 6 +1 3 Argentina 3 0 0 3 1 15 −14 0 === Group D === Team 3 2 1 0 3 1 +2 7 3 2 0 1 5 2 +3 6 3 1 0 2 2 5 −3 3 3 0 1 2 3 5 −2 1 == Knockout stage == {{Round8-with third |1 October||1||0 |2 October||7||1 |1 October||1||2 |2 October||0||1 |5 October||0||3 |5 October||2||1 |12 October||2||1 |12 October||3||1 }} === Third place match === === Final === == References == Category:2003 in association football Category:2003 in the United States Category:Soccer in the United States Category:FIFA Women's World Cup
